listicle_content.listicle: The crisis arose when there was a by-election in the parliamentary constituency of Tura after the death of sitting MP and former Lok Sabha Speaker PA Sangma. Chief Minister Sangma prevailed over the Congress leadership to give the ticket to his wife Dikanchi Shira.

When the results were declared on May 19, she lost to PA Sangma\'s son Conrad Sangma by close to two lakh votes. Sensing weakness, the knives were soon out, demanding a change of leadership. The state Congress president accused the Chief Minister of taking unilateral decisions.

However, unlike the situation in Uttarakhand and Arunachal Pradesh, the Congress leadership acted swiftly. Sources say that both the camps were summoned by Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi. The deal that was reached included another meeting with Congress president Sonia Gandhi, which is yet to happen. It\'s ceasefire until then.

Shillong MP and former Union minister Vincent Pala has been given the task of making the legislators see the light. Pala says, \"I met the legislators and told them not to not fall prey to the overtures of the BJP.\"
The Meghalaya Assembly has 60 members, of which the Congress has 30. While the NCP supports it by 2 MLAs, there are 11 independent MLAs too.

Pala has been instrumental in bringing the animosity down. There were also murmurs that he could be made the Chief Minister as a compromise. But now, it seems that Chief Minister Sangma will continue, but not before \"adjusting\" some loyalists of the state Congress president at several key positions which includes the chair of several key corporations.

The Congress fears that it may face another situation like Uttarakhand. Vincent Pala says that the \"BJP is instigating legislators in the state and are also trying to create a crisis. But there is no problem to our government.\"

After the intervention of the central leadership, there has been some status quo. The Congress legislators feel that it could be a major crisis in the state from which it would be difficult to retrieve the situation.

The fear has become even more real with the advent of NEDA or North East Democratic Alliance. Its convenor Hemanta Biswa Sarma is a tall leader of the North-East, especially after the Assam election. The Congress can certainly be sidelined with the stitching-up of this alliance.

Since V Narayansami, Congress incharge of Meghalaya, is set to be the Chief Minister of Puducherry, he does not want to speak on the issue, but Congress MP from Assam and senior spokesperson Sushmita Dev says, \"At the AICC level, they are handling the matter. There\'s no crisis from our side. Hope the BJP doesn\'t resort to illegal and coercive methods.\"

Sources say that with the intervention of the Congress leadership, the matter is under control for now. But as things go for the Congress, it could be another mountain to climb in yet another hilly state.

An open fight has broken out between state Congress president DD Lapang and Chief Minister Mukul Sangma, a pattern similar to what happened in the other three hill states.
